unnormalised: It was 7:45 AM, and Priya’s alarm clock blared. Another Monday. She hit snooze, just once, knowing she needed to prepone her morning routine. Today was crucial; the project kickoff was scheduled for 10:00 AM sharp, and everything had to run like clockwork. Her chai, usually a leisurely affair, was gulped down in 5 mins flat.
normalised: It was seven forty five A-M, and Priya’s alarm clock blared. Another Monday. She hit snooze, just once, knowing she needed to prepone her morning routine. Today was crucial; the project kickoff was scheduled for ten A-M sharp, and everything had to run like clockwork. Her chai, usually a leisurely affair, was gulped down in five minutes flat.

unnormalised: She glanced at her Outlook calendar. The first meeting was at 10:00 AM, followed by a team debriefing at 12:30 PM. Then, a client call at 3:00 PM, prep for which needed to start latest by 2:00 PM. And finally, the weekly report was due COB today. COB – Close of Business, typically considered 5:00 PM, but she knew it would likely stretch beyond that. The joy of the corporate world!
normalised: She glanced at her Outlook calendar. The first meeting was at ten A-M, followed by a team debriefing at twelve thirty P-M. Then, a client call at three P-M, prep for which needed to start latest by two P-M. And finally, the weekly report was due C-O-B today. C-O-B – Close of Business, typically considered five P-M, but she knew it would likely stretch beyond that. The joy of the corporate world!

unnormalised: Priya reached the office by 9:30 AM, slightly flustered by the traffic. She quickly reviewed her presentation slides one last time. The project timeline was tight, with key milestones marked for 15/09/2024 and final delivery slated for 30/11/2024. No room for error. She confirmed that Rakesh had already set up the projector and teleconferencing system.
normalised: Priya reached the office by nine thirty A-M, slightly flustered by the traffic. She quickly reviewed her presentation slides one last time. The project timeline was tight, with key milestones marked for fifteenth september two thousand and twenty four and final delivery slated for thirtieth november two thousand and twenty four. No room for error. She confirmed that Rakesh had already set up the projector and teleconferencing system.

unnormalised: The 10:00 AM meeting started promptly. It went on till almost 11:45 AM. There was a long discussion on resource allocation that spilled over to lunch. Priya barely managed to get a sandwich before rushing to the 12:30 PM debrief. Post debriefing, she realized that the meeting had thrown her schedule into disarray.
normalised: The ten A-M meeting started promptly. It went on till almost eleven forty five A-M. There was a long discussion on resource allocation that spilled over to lunch. Priya barely managed to get a sandwich before rushing to the twelve thirty P-M debrief. Post debriefing, she realized that the meeting had thrown her schedule into disarray.

unnormalised: The client call at 3:00 PM also ran longer than expected, wrapping up close to 4:15 PM. A last-minute request from the client to add another feature before 20/10/2024 threatened to derail the entire schedule. Priya had to now re-jig everything. Her team looked stressed; they were already working overtime to meet the original deadline.
normalised: The client call at three P-M also ran longer than expected, wrapping up close to four fifteen P-M. A last-minute request from the client to add another feature before twentieth october two thousand and twenty four threatened to derail the entire schedule. Priya had to now re-jig everything. Her team looked stressed; they were already working overtime to meet the original deadline.

unnormalised: Priya finally managed to start on the weekly report around 6:00 PM. By 8:00 PM, she was still slogging away, fueled by multiple cups of chai. She glanced at her calendar for tomorrow: 9:00 AM status call, 11:00 AM vendor meeting, and a workshop scheduled for 2:30 PM. The cycle continues.
normalised: Priya finally managed to start on the weekly report around six P-M. By eight P-M, she was still slogging away, fueled by multiple cups of chai. She glanced at her calendar for tomorrow: nine A-M status call, eleven A-M vendor meeting, and a workshop scheduled for two thirty P-M. The cycle continues.

unnormalised: She finally submitted the report at 9:30 PM. Exhausted but relieved, Priya packed her bag and headed home. As she waited for her auto-rickshaw, she checked her messages. One from her mother reminding her about Diwali preparations, scheduled to start from 25/10/2024. Priya sighed. Work-life balance. Still a distant dream. She hoped the next day would be less chaotic. At least the weekend was coming up. Maybe she could finally catch up on some sleep.
normalised: She finally submitted the report at nine thirty P-M. Exhausted but relieved, Priya packed her bag and headed home. As she waited for her auto-rickshaw, she checked her messages. One from her mother reminding her about Diwali preparations, scheduled to start from twenty fifth october two thousand and twenty four. Priya sighed. Work-life balance. Still a distant dream. She hoped the next day would be less chaotic. At least the weekend was coming up. Maybe she could finally catch up on some sleep.
